channel.title: Comments on: What was your first computer and what were some of your favorite games?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: My First Computer | Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting
item.dc:creator: My First Computer | Denny Cherry & Associates Consulting
item.description: […] I was tagged by Denis Gobo in his post What was your first computer…. […]
item.content:encoded: […] I was tagged by Denis Gobo in his post What was your first computer…. […]

item.title: By: THolt
item.dc:creator: THolt
item.content:encoded:
Commodore 64, I was maybe 5 years old…playing Circus Stars and Steve Garvey Baseball!

Too bad I had no clue in starting to code back then, I had the perfect machine to start learning with!

item.title: By: Derek Ledbetter
item.dc:creator: Derek Ledbetter
item.content:encoded:
The first system I had was an Atari 2600, but that’s a video game console, not a computer. Then I got a Times Sinclair 1000, but I never had any really good games for that. Then I stepped up to an Atari 800XL. My favorite games were:

The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy
Autoduel
M.U.L.E.

item.title: By: cheap beer
item.dc:creator: cheap beer
item.description: This is awesome, i really dont remember my first computer but it was like on 1995, and the video game was the play station with mario bros
item.content:encoded: This is awesome, i really dont remember my first computer but it was like on 1995, and the video game was the play station with mario bros

item.title: By: ThatRickGuy
item.dc:creator: ThatRickGuy
item.content:encoded:
I cut my teeth on a TI and Apple 2, eventually moving up to a Apple 2 GS and a Mac Classic. The first one I would really consider my own though, was a 386sx 25mhz.

Played all the PC classics: Secret Agent Man (SAM series), Commander Keen, Robinhood: Quest for Long Bow, Quest for Glory 1 and 2, Escape from Monkey Island. And plenty more.

I still think Quest for Glory 1 and 2, and Escape from Monkey Island are some of the best video games ever produced.

-Rick

item.title: By: Tahir Khalid
item.dc:creator: Tahir Khalid
item.content:encoded:
Ah memories, my first computer was a Texus Instruments thingie, quite powerful however being young I killed it quite quickly.

I missed the C64 (such a shame) and instead skipped over to the otherside with a ZX Spectrum (and later the 128+) – legendary games!

Then came along an Amstrad CPC I inherited from a family member, what an awesome machine (still have it sitting somewhere in the attic).

Then the mighty Amiga A500, I really got settled down on this wonder kit. Had all the custom bits (memory, drive) and lots of software and games (“Shadow of The Beast” anyone?^^), also the first computer where I learn’t programming I think on something called AMOS? I still regret selling my Amiga…

After this I got hooked on consoles and still own the following:

SNES, Megadrive, N64, Dreamcast (awesome), Neo-Geo

The only consoles I play now are my PS3 and Dreamcast, DC because it still has some awesome titles and cool graphics (House of The Dead rocks!).

They really don’t make games like they used to…

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.content:encoded:
First computer was the VIC-20 from Canadian Tire. I still remember I had to take it
back 3 times to get a working one. The count by scott adams is by far, on that computer,
where I spent countless hours. Then after a long time I got the commodore 64c. I stayed up for hours with friends
playing the Great American Road Race. We pulled all nighters playing that thing, fun but what
waste of time, and a good waste of time that was. Impossible Mission was another one as was Mail
order monsters and Racing Destruction Set. Those were the most heavily played games on my 64.
Not to mention International Karate or yes Yie-ar-kungfu and Space Taxi.

Today with emulators! Wow! I’ve got some old computers I’m setting up for games for my kids,
nieces and nephews. All you need is an old computer, an emulator and a couple of game controllers.
You’re all set.

By the way, I still have my old Vic20 and my commodore 64, those were the days.

For anyone out there. I would have to say the 2 best emulators out there are CCS64 and VICE.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Yasser,

Check out MAME (Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator)

http://mamedev.org/

item.title: By: Yasser Abbasi
item.dc:creator: Yasser Abbasi
item.description: My first computer was a Commodore 64. Does anyone know of any emulators that run games like Decathlon, Pole position, Yie ar kungfu, Kungfu master etc. I used to love these games!
item.content:encoded: My first computer was a Commodore 64. Does anyone know of any emulators that run games like Decathlon, Pole position, Yie ar kungfu, Kungfu master etc. I used to love these games!
